title: (x) Cole Trickle - Brush Script {Yves, Chesh}
content:
[http://pic.coleracing.de/downloads/games/nr2003/cars/46\_c\_trickle\_my.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031054620/http:/pic.coleracing.de/downloads/games/nr2003/cars/46_c_trickle_my.jpg)   
   
I need to know the font which they used to write "Cole Trickle" (above the door).   
It's a bit hard to see at this angle, but any help would be appreciated!   
   
thanks!!

 [‹ (x) MELROSE PLACE - Futura {Adriano S)](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031054620/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4109 "Go to previous forum topic") [Lacrimosa font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031054620/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4025 "Go to next forum topic")
author: 88keys

comments.content: Could it be [Brush Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031054620/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/brush-script/brush-script/testdrive.html?s=Cole%20Trickle%2046&p=72) you're looking for? ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031054620im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Very hard to see, but it looks like [Brush Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031054620/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/brush-script/brush-script/testdrive.html?s=Cole%2BTrickle&p=72), which is a very common default font for sign painters.   
   
(No offense meant to artisan sign painters!)
